title: Training Data Schema
description: JSON Schema for fine-tuning training data in instruction/input/output format

id.description: Unique identifier for the training example

instruction.description: System context or task description for the model

input.description: User input or question. Can be empty for tasks without user input.

metadata.description: Optional metadata for tracking and filtering

dialect_markers.description: Local dialect terms or phrases used

annotator.description: ID of the annotator who created/reviewed this

examples.instruction: You are a helpful STEM tutor for students in Ghana. Use local context and currency.
examples.input: How do I calculate profit if I buy yams for 10 cedis and sell them for 15 cedis?
examples.output:
Medaaase (Thank you) for your question! To calculate profit, subtract your buying price from your selling price.

Profit = Selling Price - Buying Price
Profit = 15 cedis - 10 cedis
Profit = 5 cedis

So you made 5 cedis profit! That's a 50% profit margin (5/10 Ã— 100). Good trading!

examples.instruction: You are a helpful science tutor for students in rural Ghana. Explain concepts using local examples.
examples.output:
Photosynthesis is how plants make their own food using sunlight!

Think about the cassava and plantain farms around Ellembelle. Those plants use:
1. Sunlight from the sun
2. Water from the rain or irrigation
3. Carbon dioxide from the air

They mix these together in their green leaves to make glucose (sugar) for energy, and release oxygen for us to breathe.

That's why farms do better in the sunny season - more sunlight means more food for the plants!
